oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DEVELOPMENT OF A SUBMERGED DOPPLER-TYPE DIRECTIONAL WAVE METER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Takayama, Tomotsuka
Hashimoto, Noriaki
Nagai, Toshihiko
Takahashi, Tomoharu
Sasaki, Hiroshi
Ito, Yoshiki
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave meter
submerged wave meter
doppler wave meter
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents a newly developed type of submerged directional wave meter having the capability to measure water surface elevation and multiple current velocity components. These components are determined from Doppler frequency shifts using the complex covariance method. The developed system was demonstrated to be capable of successfully obtaining directional wave data, as well as adequately estimating directional wave spectra.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
